title: Verify that the Hold code drop down work correctly for Package having deferred seating events in the Best available page

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Admin
2.Click NEW option to create a new 
3.Select supplier and get navigated to event creation page
4.Select inventory type as 'Defered seating'
5.Enter values for all mandatory fields
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
4. 1.Navigate to Event Access tab for this newly created event
2.Select the option 'Transaction Types and Dates' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned in previous step
6. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Search for the event EVT1 mentioned above
Verify that a 'Hold Code' drop down is displayed in the best available interface for a deferred seating event
7. 1.Navigate to 'All Hold Codes' tab and find out the seat availability in different hold codes
2.Now navigate back to 'Price Scales' tab
3.Now select any other hold code (which has some seats available) from the 'Hold code' drop down
4.Now navigate to 'Sections' tab and verify the details
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Defered seating event  event should be created successfully
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event for the user U1
5. Login should be successfull
6. Hold Codes' drop down should be displayed in the Best Available interface for deferred seating event.
7. 1. 'All Hold Codes' tab should display the seat availability in different hold codes
2. 'Price Scales' tab should display the details 
3.The selected hold codeshould be displayed in the 'Hold code' drop down
4.'Sections' tab should display the details

title: Verify that upon selecting unassigned seats from more than one price scale, capacity engine can rollover price scale if the first price scale does not have enough capacity.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Admin
2.Click NEW option to create a new event
3.Seletcf supplier and get navigated to event creation page
4.Select inventory type as 'Deferred Seating'
5.Enter values for all mandatory fields
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
4. 1.Navigate to Event Access tab for this newly created event
2.Select the option 'Transaction Types and Dates' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned in previous step
6. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Enter the seat count in such a way that seat count entered should be higher than the count of first price scales.
Eg: Select 2 price scales - say MPRINC and  MROYAL.
14 seats available for MPRINC and 35 seats available for MROYAL
Enter Seat count as 20.
7. Verify that upon selecting unassigned seats from more than one price scale, capacity engine can rollover price scale if the first price scale does not have enough capacity
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Deferred seating event should be created successfully
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event for the user U1
5. Login should be successfull
6. The 'Assignable' column should not be displayed if the search result does not include any deferred seating event
7. Capacity engine should be able to rollover price scale if the first price scale does not have enough capacity and seats should be considered from second price scale.

title: Verify that seats are locked successfully for a package list with deferred seating events and seat type as same price scale if all events have enough seats in the opted price scale - user has permission to assign seats

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Admin
2.Click NEW option to create a new event
3.Seletcf supplier and get navigated to event creation page
4.Select inventory type as 'Deferred Seating"
5.Enter all mandatory fields
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
4. 1.Navigate to Event Access tab for this newly created deferred seating event
2.Select the option 'Transaction Types and Dates' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Navigate to Package Event List Admin
2.Click NEW option to create a new package event list.
3.Select supplier and get navigated to package event list creation page
4.Select inventory type as 'Deferred Seating' and Event List Status as 'Master Only'
5.Include the deferred seating events to this package event list and Enter all mandatory fields
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
6. 1.Navigate to Package List Access tab for this newly created package event list
2.Select the option 'Transaction Types and Dates' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
7. 1.Navigate to Package Admin.
2.Click New to create a new Package.
3.Enter all mandatory fields and click on APPLY CHANGES button.
4.Navigate to Event List of Package created above and include the deferred seating package event list and save.
8. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned in previous step
9. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Search for the Package created above that contains deferred seating package event list and master event
3.Select the seat type as "Same Price Scale' and all events from package event list which has enough seats in the opted price scale 
4.Verify that seats are locked successfully for a package list with deferred seating events and seat type as 'same price scale' if all events have enough seats in the opted price scale - user has permission to assign seats
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Deferred Seating event should be created successfully
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for deferred seating event for the user U1
5. Deferred Seating package event list with deferred seating events should be created successfully
6. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this deferred seating package event list for the user U1
7. Deferred Seating package event list should be included with Package created.
8. Login should be successfull
9. Seats should be locked successfully for a package list with deferred seating events and seat type as 'same price scale' if all events have enough seats in the opted price scale - user do not have permission to assign seats

title: Verify that Hold Code drop down section in best available interface is left blank for a non inventoried package event list if capacity is NOT set for the event

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Admin
2.Click NEW option to create some events
3.Seletcf supplier and get navigated to event creation page
4.Select inventory type as 'Non Inventoried'
5.Enter all mandatory fields
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
7.Navigate to Capacity Control tab and do not set the Capacity Limit at event level for any of the event and save.
4. 1.Navigate to Package Event List Admin
2.Click NEW option to create a new package event list.
3.Select supplier and get navigated to package event list creation page
4.Select inventory type as 'Non Inventoried'
5.Enter all mandatory fields
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Navigate to Events tab of non-inventoried package event list created above.
2.Include non inventoried events to this package event list.
3.Click on APPLY CHANGES button.
6. 1.Navigate to Package Admin.
2.Click New to create a new Package.
3.Enter all mandatory fields and click on APPLY CHANGES button.
4.Navigate to Event List of Package created above and include the non-inventoried event list and save.
7. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Search for the Package created above that contains non-inventoried package event list.
3.Verify that 'Hold Code' drop down section in best available interface is left blank
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Non-Inventoried event should be created successfully and capacity limit should not be set at event level.
4. Non-Inventoried package event list  should be created successfully
5. Non-inventoried events should be successfully included in the Non-Inventoried package event list.
6. Non-inventoried package event list should be included with Package created.
7. Hold Code' drop down section in best available interface should be left blank for a non inventoried package event list if capacity is NOT set for the event

title: Verify performing a reservation transaction with assigned seats for a variable package that includes a deferred seating primary event

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Admin
2.Create 4 or 5 deferred seating events 
3.Note down the seat related details(section values, row, seat number) for all these events
4.Navigate to Package Event List Admin
5.Create a deferred seating event with Event list type as 'VARIABLE'
6.Navigate to Events tab and include all the events created above 
7.Select the min/max event count values
8.Click APPLY CHANGES
4. 1.Navigate to Package Admin
2.Click NEW option to create a new package
3.Select the supplier and get navigated to package creation page
4.Enter values for all mandatory fields
5.Click APPLY CHANGES to create the package
6.Navigate to 'Event List' tab and include the event list  created above
5. 1.select the package event list craeted above in step 4
2.Navigate to Package List Access tab 
3.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
4.Select a user, say U1
5.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
6. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned in previous step
7. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the package mentioned above
3.Select the required events for the variable package event list
4.select seats and get navigated to cart
8. Verify the details displayed in sales cart
9. 1.Click the 'Modify' link in the offer block
2.Click the 'View Events' link 
3.Verify the seat details displayed for the events
10. 1.Click the 'Reserve' link against this offer 
2.Click the 'SET TO RESERVATION' option displayed
11. 1.Click the 'Modify' link in the offer block
2.Click the 'View Events' link 
3.Verify the seat details displayed
12. Click CHECKOUT to complete the transaction
13. 1.Launch squirell application
2.Login using suitable credentials
3.Run the below mentione query:
select * from TICKET where Transaction_Id = xxxx

where xxxx is the Transaction Id of the transaction completed in previous step
4.Verify whether Seat ID and Hoild Code ID are recorded for this transaction
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Variable package event list should be created successfully with inventory type as 'deferred seating'
4. Package should be created successfully.
The event list should be added successfully to this package
5. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event list for the user U1
6. Login should be successfull
7. Seats should be locked in sales cart successfully
8. It should be displayed as 'Assigned - Package Sale' in the offer block
9. Actual seat details should not be displayed in the offer block. 
Only the section, row and seat number details entered in Event admin page for the event(noted in step 3) should be displayed
10. The offer should be changed to 'Reservation' offer.
It should be displayed as 'Assigned - Package Reservation' in the offer block
11. Actual seat details should not be displayed in the offer block. 
Only the corresponding section, row and seat number details for the events(noted in step 3) should be displayed
12. Package Reservation transaction with assigned seats should be completed successfully
13. Seat ID and Hold Code ID should NOT be  for all the tickets
The seat details should be displayed correctly in the table
